Signal Messenger

Improving Private Signal Calls: Call Links & More

If you love group calls on Signal, but don‚Äôt want to create a group chat for every combination of your friends or colleagues, you‚Äôre in luck. Today we‚Äôre launching call links: Share a link with anyone on Signal and in just a tap or click they can...

Signal (@signalapp@mastodon.world)

We‚Äôve improved private group video calls in Signal with new features, incl. call links. Create a link that anyone on Signal can use to join a group call *without* having to join a Signal group chat first + raise hand, emoji reactions, calls tab,...

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
Tired of Zoom? Well, I can attend a Zoom meeting without having an account on Zoom.

I wonder if in the future, joining Signal calls without an account be possible or not.

ponytail:

Well, I can attend a Zoom meeting without having an account on Zoom

If it‚Äôs a small group with 4 devices/people or fewer, you can use Brave Talk, no registration required: https://talk.brave.com/ (based on Jitsi Meet)

For larger group calls, you‚Äôd have to sign in with a Google, Facebook or GitHub account (maybe with a disposable email) for Jitsi Meet: https://meet.jit.si/
With Jitsi Meet you can use a randomised or custom URL name.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: there‚Äôs also Jitsi instances hosted by Framasoft (https://framatalk.org/) and Debian (https://jitsi.debian.social/). the framatalk one requires email-password registration by host for moderation purposes, the debian one to my knowledge does not.

rassilon1963:

the debian one to my knowledge does not

Thanks, I opened the Debian link and it asked for a login eventually!

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
@Aku-Stable @rassilon1963 Thank you!

I believe, for any video conferencing software/application, the option to attend a meeting without an account is essential for its mass adoption.

Yes, the purpose of Signal can not way be compared to Zoom or Google Meet. At the end, Signal is a messaging platform.

Those who are looking for an alternative to Zoom or Meet would ideally like to have a ‚Äòno account needed‚Äô feature to attend meetings. At least I would. I do not want to create an account just so I can attend a meeting.

Imagine a situation where a person who want to join a Signal meeting installs the Signal app - pasts the meeting URL in the app and joins it, without having to sign up for Signal. If that becomes possible, I will be able to use Signal for all meetings. However, right now, the first step remains to convince others to join Signal first.

Hello,

In the announcement post the fact that the links are reusable is a little buried. No problem with that on it‚Äôs face, it‚Äôs a feature heavy update.

However, if I could suggest something within the app to suggest that and a feature to group links together.

Imagine I am the admin for a repeating weekly meeting. While I could access the link within a Google calendar invite, it would also be convenient to have that link easily findable upon opening the app.

Maybe call links can be by default pinned to the top of the call history list? Unpinnable by option, or even deletable if the user wishes to delete. Perhaps a way to save these pinned call links from being expunged by ‚Äúclear history‚Äù as well, with an option to expunge them if desired.

Love the feature, it makes sharing Signal or onboarding others much easier.

I hope this is an appropriate place for feedback.

Thanks!
